channel.title: John's Music & Tech
channel.description: Recent content on John's Music & Tech

item.title: The $51 Printer That Outlived Everything: A 2025 Look at the Brother HL-2230
item.description: A 12-year retrospective on a $51 Brother HL-2230 laser printer that quietly outlived computers, operating systems, and entire life chapters ‚Äî and still just works in 2025.

item.title: üé∞ The New App Store Wild West: How Scam ‚ÄúCash Games‚Äù Are Slipping Through Apple‚Äôs Review
item.description: Apple‚Äôs once-trusted App Store has become fertile ground for fake ‚Äòcash games‚Äô that promise instant PayPal payouts. Here‚Äôs how they got in, why people believe them, and what that says about Apple‚Äôs changing priorities.

item.title: Quiet Genius: What GFI Understood About Modern Steel Design
item.description: A reflection on Gene Fields, his enduring influence on GFI, and how smart engineering outlasts its maker.

item.title: When the Lights Went Out
item.description: An in-depth look at how Hollywood‚Äôs digital transition quietly dismantled the movie theater business, long before the pandemic.

item.title: ‚ÄòOutdated‚Äô or Timeless? Why Jeff Newman Still Speaks to Modern Steel Players
item.description: Jeff Newman‚Äôs lessons may be decades old, but for players rooted in Americana and alt-country, they‚Äôre as relevant as ever.

item.title: The Space Invaders Snare: Alabama‚Äôs Accidental Arcade Moment
item.description: When Alabama tried to go digital and accidentally went arcade instead.

item.title: Two Years With the Chevy Bolt: The Best Car I‚Äôve Ever Owned
item.description:
Two Years With the Chevy Bolt: The Best Car I‚Äôve Ever Owned

I‚Äôll say it upfront: the Chevy Bolt is the best car I‚Äôve ever owned.

When I decided to go electric, I already knew the Bolt was nearing the end of its run. The 2023 model would be the last‚Äîand finding one wasn‚Äôt easy. Most dealers were out of stock, and the few that did get them sold them almost immediately.

item.title: üïπÔ∏è 40 Years With the Atari ST: From Zapenu to GitHub
item.description: Reflecting on the Atari ST‚Äôs 40th anniversary, the machine that launched my programming journey ‚Äî from cover disks to GitHub.

item.title: üé∏ What I Learned (and Didn‚Äôt) from the Founding Father Method‚Ñ¢
item.description: An honest, good-faith reflection on a high-profile steel guitar course (yes, that one). What worked, what didn‚Äôt, and what I wish I knew before signing up. My Paul Westerberg ‚ÄúLet It Be‚Äù moment.

item.title: What AI Is Doing to Software Development (and What It Can‚Äôt Do Yet)
item.description: Reflections on how AI tools like ChatGPT are reshaping software development‚Äîfrom the bookshelf era to side-project breakthroughs.

item.title: What I‚Äôve Been Doing and Where I Go From Here
item.description:
For the past few years, I‚Äôve been balancing a range of creative and technical interests ‚Äî pedal steel guitar, app development, retro computing, and more ‚Äî all while working full-time at Sweetwater in Fort Wayne, IN. I‚Äôve been part of both the mobile and desktop teams there for over five years, helping build the tools customers use every day.

I‚Äôve also moved the blog to a new domain: johnsmusicandtech.com. The name reflects what this space is really about ‚Äî the intersection of sound and software, strings and code, music and machines. It’s still me writing, just under a name that better fits the shape of things going forward.

item.title: GFI
item.description:
Two historic guitars are on display in the GFI room.

This belonged to Ralph Mooney:

This was a Gene Fields guitar:

Gene was a great innovator. It was interesting to see his work in person.

item.title: Texas Steel Guitar Jamboree
item.description: I am in Dallas for my first Jamboree! I am halfway through Doug Jerningan’s seminar. There is a lot to take in, but it has been very informative. Doug is a great player and teacher. He has prepared an extensive course for today’s seminar.
